thread.title: Robo Slug? New York Comic Con attendees give super-hero names to Colby Rasmus
thread.title_full: Robo Slug? New York Comic Con attendees give super-hero names to Colby Rasmus | AL.com

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: Robo Slug? New York Comic Con attendees give super-hero names to Colby Rasmus
text:
Former Russell County prep star Colby Rasmus hit a home run in all three of the Houston Astros' playoff games last week, set an MLB record with an extra-base hit in each of the first six postseason games of his career and has collected six home runs in the Astros' past six games. But it was his celebration of the Astros' victory over the New York Yankees in the American League wild-card game on Tuesday that had people buzzing.
For instance, what super power does Rasmus have? And what is his super-hero moniker?
MLB players have taken to wearing goggles during the champagne- and beer-soaked clubhouse celebrations of pennant-clinchers and postseason advancement. The Astros moved on to an AL Division Series by beating the Yankees 3-0 , and Rasmus was ready with a pair of almost-insect-looking dark goggles for the postgame party.
A picture of a shirtless Rasmus in his goggles prompted Sports Illustrated to ask attendees at the New York Comic Con to speculate on his super-hero appearance.
We asked people to give @astros outfielder Colby Rasmusan alter ego at Comic Con https://t.co/JXfYJcORrn
— Sports Illustrated (@SInow) October 9, 2015 The Astros resume their series against the Kansas City Royals at 3 p.m. CDT Sunday in Houston. Each team has one victory in the best-of-five series. MLB Network will televise the game.
Rasmus was Alabama's Mr. Baseball in 2005, when he led Russell County to the Class 5A championship.
Because Colby Rasmus. pic.twitter.com/ZMAt7BEmGu
— SportsNation (@SportsNation) October 7, 2015
